intro: Henckelia scortechinii, commonly known as the giant rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Henckelia scortechinii is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants.
